agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that offers community activities and assistance.
service_description: Provides staple items such as vegetables, bakery items, and prepackaged meals. Items vary based on donations.  Distribution is based on a first come, first serve basis.
site_details: Sign in upon arriving
site_eligibility: Open -- Living in Jefferson County -- Limit of one bag per individual

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that offers community activities and assistance.
service_description: Provides holiday clothing and gift assistance for eligible Jefferson County children in need. Distribution information will be provided during application process to families who are approved for the program.
site_details: Only one member from household may enter
site_schedule: Oct 30-31; 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Nov 1st; 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Nov 2-3; noon-7pm
site_eligibility: Living in Jefferson County -- Household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level -- With children ages 12 or younger

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that offers community activities and assistance.
service_description: Provides a free meal for people in need.
site_details: Walk in
site_schedule: Breakfast: Mon-Fri 9am-10am -- Lunch: Mon-Fri noon-1pm -- Monthly last Sat 11am-noon
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Provides emergency rent or utility assistance one time a year for those in need. All assistance is provided on a case-by-case basis.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or apply online.
site_eligibility: Resident of Jefferson County -- Have not received assistance in the last year (365 days)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that delivers services which promote workforce development.
service_description: Provides child care vouchers for low-income families who are working or in school. Families under 100% of the federal poverty level may receive free child care; families between 100-127% of the poverty level may receive child care at a sliding-scale rate.
site_details: Visit the website for an application. -- After application is reviewed, applicants will be contacted to schedule an individual appointment. -- After the individual appointment, approved applicants will be placed on a wait list or informed of open enrollment events for their region.
site_eligibility: Living in Clark, Decatur, Floyd, Harrison, Jackson, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, Scott, Switzerland, or Washington County -- Parents of children birth through age 12 (or up to 18, if child is disabled) -- Working or enrolled in school -- Income under 127% federal poverty guideline -- Child receiving assistance must be a US Citizen or qualified legal alien [Note: Some requirements may be waived for licensed foster parents seeking care for foster children, or for parents with a referral from the Department of Child Services (DCS) or from TANF/IMPACT].

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that delivers services which promote workforce development.
service_name: HIGH SCHOOL EQUIVALENCY DIPLOMA PREPARATION CLASSES
service_description: Offers free preparation for the high school equivalency test at community locations in Dearborn, Franklin, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland county. Classes are offered during day and evening hours; online instruction is also available.
site_details: Call for information about the next orientation; enrollment forms will be completed during orientation.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Class days and times vary by location
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older (16-17 admitted upon request; high school exit exam required)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that delivers services which promote workforce development.
service_description: Coaches individuals to secure employment. Participants attend a job-readiness workshop, where they will learn how to write an effective resume and improve job interviews. Soft skills training for job retention are also addressed.
site_details: Call for information or to find out when the next workshop will be.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Motivated to become self-sufficient -- Have no record of violent crimes/sexual offenses -- Pass a drug test

service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Jefferson County residents. Regulates septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and air or water pollution. Oversees mosquito and rodent control programs and offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as water quality and lead contamination.

service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm  Classes: All day classes available
site_eligibility: Living in Jefferson, Jennings, or Scott County -- Ages 3-5 years-old (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit that opens doors to better quality lives through comprehensive services and community partnerships.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Jefferson, Jennings, and Scott County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area will be available on Tuesday, November 1, 2022 beginning at 8am. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Please call or visit the website for the most current information on waitlist availability.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. -- Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A nonprofit that opens doors to better quality lives through comprehensive services and community partnerships.
service_description: Provides a weatherization program for low-income households to help reduce home heating and cooling bills. Projects may include attic insulation, weather-stripping, caulking, and sometimes replacement of furnaces, air conditioners, hot water heaters, and inefficient appliances such as refrigerators and stoves.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application. -- Priority is given to homes with the highest heating costs based on the Home Heating Index calculation.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- With household income at or below 200% of Federal Poverty Guidelines

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.
site_schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

The clerk's office issues marriage licenses; files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, custody/visitation, expungement, and protective orders; processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, traffic tickets, bail bonds, and other judgments; issues arrest warrants; and oversees all elections in the county.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Jefferson County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority, including performing the following duties: controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Thurs 5pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service
